author: Avni Arya
title: Chennai, Expect 'Critical' Rain To Bring Relief From Heat As IMD Issues Orange Alert For Very Heavy Rain
text: Trending: Chennai, Expect 'Critical' Rain To Bring Relief From Heat As IMD Issues Orange Alert For Very Heavy Rain Chennai is preparing for substantial rainfall as the northeast monsoon nears, prompting an orange alert from the IMD for heavy rain on October 15 and 16. With current heavy rains impacting the city and forecasts predicting continued storms, residents are advised to stay vigilant. (Image- IMD Website) KEY HIGHLIGHTS - Chennai is bracing for significant rainfall as the northeast monsoon approaches, with an orange alert issued for October 15 and 16. - Heavy rains have already begun in various areas of the city, including Royapettah and Chepauk, with further thunderstorms expected today. - The weather forecast indicates light to moderate rain will continue throughout the week, with temperatures ranging between 30 and 33 degrees Celsius. Chennai: As the northeast monsoon (NEM) approaches, Chennai is preparing for significant rainfall, according to the popular forecaster on X, ‘Chennai Rains.’ The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an orange alert for heavy to very heavy rainfall on October 15 and 16, indicating that disruptive weather is anticipated in the city. Tamil Nadu has already begun experiencing heavy rains in various towns since last week. The Chennai Meteorological Centre has issued warnings for heavy and very heavy rainfall across the state. Chennai Rains Today In Chennai, heavy rains have been reported since early morning today in areas such as Royapettah, Thiruvalluvar Nagar, Chepauk, Anna Salai, Manali, Madhavaram, and Puzhal. The forecast indicates that light to moderate rainfall, accompanied by thunder and lightning, is likely in many places across Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal today, October 12. For Chennai, today’s weather prediction includes the possibility of moderate rain with thunder and lightning in some parts of the city. The maximum temperature is expected to range between 32-33 degrees Celsius, while the minimum temperature will hover around 25-26 degrees Celsius. Looking ahead, on October 13, light to moderate rain, along with thunder and lightning, is expected in many areas of Tamil Nadu, Puducherry, and Karaikal. The hill regions in Tiruppur and Coimbatore, as well as Nilgiris, Dindigul, Erode, and Karur districts, could see heavy rainfall at a few locations. Chennai Weekly Weather Forecast The weather forecast for Chennai over the next few days indicates a mix of partly cloudy skies and thunderstorms. On October 12, temperatures are expected to range from 32 to 33 degrees Celsius during the day, with a minimum of 25 to 26 degrees at night. Moderate rain, accompanied by thunderstorms and lightning, is likely in some areas. This pattern continues on October 13, with similar temperatures and conditions. On October 14, temperatures are projected to be between 31 and 32 degrees, with the potential for moderate to heavy rain, along with thunderstorms. The following day, October 15, will see a slight dip in temperatures to around 30 to 31 degrees, but the chance of thunderstorms and moderate to heavy rain remains. As we move into October 16, the forecast suggests temperatures around 32 degrees, with light to moderate rain expected. The week will conclude on October 17 with similar conditions, maintaining the possibility of light to moderate rain and thunderstorms. author: Redacción
title: Lolita Cortés explica por qué fue hospitalizada de emergencia: 'Me desvanecí más de 20 veces antes de llegar'
text:
Lolita Cortés, legendaria jueza de La Academia, relató que fue hospitalizada de emergencia tras desvanecerse más de 20 veces por uno de sus padecimientos.
En días pasados estuvo muy activa y realizando su vida cotidiana, incluso Lolita Cortés se volvió viral por un video donde canta ‘Tu falta de querer’ en un karaoke, interpretación que fue criticada por Apio Quijano.
La salud de la cantante Lola Cortés ha tenido altibajos en los últimos años, en especial después de que fue diagnosticada con cáncer; sin embargo, su última visita al hospital fue por otro tema.
¿Qué le pasó a Lolita Cortés?
La jueza de La Academia explicó en Instagram que fue hospitalizada por problemas con la presión arterial: “Yo sufro de presión alta y me puse muy muy mal, al parecer tuve varios desvanecimientos, más de 20, y me mandaron a descansar. Voy a estar descansando unas tres semanitas”.
Asimismo, la artista explicó que el episodio se debió a un descuido: “Esto fue culpa mía, no me tomé los medicamentos, ya me sentía bien, estoy hablando de hace meses. Es bien peligrosa la presión alta, hay mucha gente que se va por presión alta, más gente se va por presión alta que por una enfermedad como el cáncer. Cuidémonos, cuídense por favor”.
En una nueva historia de Instagram, la artista de 54 años agradeció a sus seguidores la preocupación: “Estoy muy bien, fue algo que sucedió, culpa mía, no me tomé los medicamentos, pero ahora estoy con los medicamentos al lado mío. Hay que saber ver las banderas rojas que nos indican que vamos de caída... Me desvanecí antes de llegar al hospital, más de 20 veces, eso me cuentan”.
The Texas Heart Institute explica que la presión arterial alta se define como hipertensión, aunque también se conoce como “la muerte silenciosa”; sucede cuando unas arterias muy pequeñas (arteriolas) que regulan el flujo sanguíneo se hacen estrechas y el corazón debe esforzarse más por bombear la sangre, así que la presión de los vasos aumenta.
De acuerdo con Medline Plus, si no se sigue el tratamiento puede causar enfermedades del corazón, accidente cerebrovascular, insuficiencia renal, problemas en los ojos y más.
En general, la hipertensión se trata con medicamentos y cambios de hábitos, como una alimentación baja en grasas y sal, ejercicio, dejar de fumar y controlar el estrés.
Los problemas de salud de Lolita Cortés
Lolita Cortés recibió un diagnóstico de cáncer de mama en octubre de 2023 y se encuentra en remisión tras someterse a un tratamiento que incluyó una doble mastectomía (cirugía con la que extirpan ambos senos) y cirugía subsecuente en marzo de 2024.
“Me quitaron los expansores. Me hicieron la masectomía doble, me pusieron expansores, los cuales tuve entre cuatro y cinco meses con ellos, llenándolos para tener piel. Es muy doloroso, pero me los quitaron para poner prótesis para que se vea un busto. No se ven iguales, pero ¡no me importa!, porque es el principio del fin”, dijo a medios de comunicación el pasado marzo.
En ese entonces, ella detalló que los gastos médicos la dejaron con problemas económicos, pero celebró que durante cinco años está en remisión, sin quimioterapia ni radiación: “Tomo una pastilla diario... Como dice el doctor, con un día que no me la tome, es una oportunidad que le doy al cáncer para que regrese”.
Además, la cantante mencionó a De Primera Mano en 2020 que tiene ansiedad e incluso pensó en quitarse la vida después de la muerte de su mamá: “Yo sufro de trastorno de ansiedad (TDA), yo tomo medicamentos desde hace 10 años y tengo una calidad de vida. Mi hijo estuvo investigando porque yo intenté no tomar los medicamentos para que viera que estaba sana. Es imposible... Una de estas molestias es esto, que uno siempre trata de recurrir a eso para terminar con esta angustia”.

author: Tanya Mohn
title: High-Visibility Clothing May Foil Pedestrian Crash Prevention Sensors
text:
Reflective clothing that makes people stand out to human drivers may make them invisible to automated crash prevention systems.
While much of the crash avoidance technology is getting better at identifying and stopping for pedestrians at night – the time period when most fatal pedestrian crashes occur – some systems need to be improved to avoid being confused by clothing meant to help enhance visibility to keep pedestrians safe.
Those are the main findings of a new study released on Thursday by the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety , a nonprofit financed by the insurance industry.
“These results suggest that some automakers need to tweak their pedestrian automatic emergency braking systems,” David Harkey, the Insurance Institute’s president, said in a statement. “It’s untenable that the clothes that pedestrians, cyclists and roadway workers wear to be safe may make them harder for crash avoidance technology to recognize.”
Researchers for “ A case study of nighttime pedestrian automatic emergency braking performance under different roadway lighting and pedestrian clothing conditions ,” evaluated the effects of high-visibility clothing and increased roadway lighting on the performance of the pedestrian automatic emergency braking (AEB) systems installed in three 2023 SUV models — a Honda CR-V, Mazda CX-5 and Subaru Forester.
The pedestrian crash prevention research tests were conducted with dummies wearing four different outfits: all white, all black, a highly reflective jacket, and black clothing with reflective strips like attire worn by roadway workers. Each clothing type was assessed in various nighttime lighting conditions.
MORE FROM FORBES VETTED REI Promo Codes: Save Up To 50% On Vuori, The North Face And More By Jordan Thomas The 4 Best Espresso Machines To Make Café-Quality Drinks At Home By Amanda Arnold The Subaru Forester came to a complete stop without hitting the pedestrian dummy and avoided a collision completely in all but one trial, according to the researchers. It impacted the dummy wearing clothing with reflective strips on the roadway test in one lighting condition. “Even in that run, it slowed by more than 80%,” the study noted.
The Honda CR-V and Mazda CX-5 hit the dummy in most of the test runs, but neither vehicle slowed at all when the dummy was wearing clothing with reflective strips that highlighted its limbs.
Overall, the performance of the two vehicles was mixed in the other scenarios, the safety group said.
“The placement and motion of reflective strips on the joints and limbs of pants and jackets allows drivers to quickly recognize the pattern of movement as a person,” David Kidd, a senior research scientist at the Insurance Institute and the study’s author, said in a statement. “Unfortunately, the moving strips didn’t have the same effect for the pedestrian AEB systems we tested and probably confounded their sensors.”
It was not clear why the Honda and Mazda systems “struggled with the reflective strips or how many other systems might have trouble identifying pedestrians wearing this type of clothing,” researchers for the study noted, adding that the lapse is a concern, considering how many roadway and emergency workers use similar garments on the job to mitigate risk.
“This is a worrisome blind spot,” Harkey added.
Further research is needed, the safety group said.
For more information and specific results for each of the test vehicles, click here and here .

author: David Koeller
title: Tracking severe weather: Timing, location of expected freezing rain Friday night
text:
Tracking severe weather: Timing, location of expected freezing rain Friday night
The entire state of Iowa is under a winter weather advisory Friday with freezing rain moving in from the west this afternoon.
Ice storm warnings east and north of the metro go into effect as early as 3 p.m. Friday. Expect ice accumulations of two-tenths to three-tenths of an inch, with up to another inch of snow and sleet, which could cause power outages and tree damage, along with dangerous travel conditions.
Closings | Interactive Radar | Weather Alerts
Here's what you need to know:
Timing, location of expected freezing rain Friday night
Light freezing drizzle or freezing rain is expected to develop over western Iowa during the early evening, mainly after 5 p.m. This will initially impact areas around Atlantic, Creston, and Lamoni. The freezing drizzle and light freezing rain should then expand into the Des Moines metro by 7 to 9 p.m. and spread across the rest of the state by Midnight to 3 a.m. The freezing rain should generally be on the light side, but with temperatures in the 20s, we will see ice accumulation.
Rain rates likely increase between 3 and 6 a.m. Saturday, resulting in more significant accumulations of ice. This is most likely to occur just east of Des Moines, affecting areas around Ottumwa up to Marshalltown and back west to Newton and Pella. Ice accumulations of around or just over a quarter-inch are possible in this area. That is enough to not only create treacherous travel, but also possibly cause some minor tree damage and scattered power outages.
In the Des Moines metro, ice accumulations should be a little lighter and come to an end by 7 to 8 a.m. as temperatures climb above freezing. Still, very slick roads and some minor ice accumulation on trees and power lines is likely. The warmer temperatures should spread across the rest of the state during the morning hours, turning the freezing rain over to a plain, cold rain and ending the icing threat.
Travel not advised: Stay home if you can
Freezing rain resulting in accumulating ice across most of Iowa will make for potentially dangerous travel conditions Friday afternoon into Saturday morning.
In some areas, including the warned areas north and east of the metro, the National Weather Service warns that travel could be nearly impossible as roads — especially bridges and overpasses — could be very icy and slick.
Injuries can happen when you slip and fall
If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways, Polk County Emergency Management warns. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
VIDEO: Iowa road crews, airport workers prepare for freezing rain
Polk County Extreme Temperature Plan in effect
Polk County Emergency Management's Extreme Temperature Plan is in effect through Friday due to dangerously cold conditions.
As part of the plan, Des Moines Area Regional Transport will provide free rides to warming centers in Polk County. See a full list of local warming centers.
Weekend forecast for Des Moines
Today: Cloudy. High 25F. Winds E at 10 to 20 mph.
Tonight: Cloudy with light freezing rain expected, becoming heavier overnight. Some icing likely. Low 25F. Winds ESE at 10 to 20 mph.
Saturday: Freezing rain early, changing to rain in the afternoon. Some icing possible. High around 35F. Winds E at 10 to 20 mph.
Saturday night: Showers tapering off in the evening with foggy conditions overnight. Low 32F. Winds N at 5 to 10 mph.
Sunday: Cloudy skies. High 42F. Winds S at 10 to 15 mph.
Sunday night: A few clouds from time to time. Low 33F. Winds SW at 10 to 15 mph.

author: ABC News
title: Workers in New England states looking forward to a bump up in minimum wages in 2024 - ABC News
text: Workers in New England states looking forward to a bump up in minimum wages in 2024 Workers in several New England states are looking forward to a bump up in the minimum wage in 2024 while advocates in Massachusetts are pushing a ballot question aimed at phasing out the state’s subminimum wage for tipped workers BOSTON -- Workers in several New England states are looking forward to a bump up in the minimum wage in 2024 while advocates in Massachusetts are pushing a ballot question aimed at phasing out the state's subminimum wage of $6.75 per hour for tipped workers. In Rhode Island, the state's current $13 minimum wage will jump by $1 to $14 an hour on Jan. 1. It is the next step in a phased-in increase that will reach $15 in 2025. In Vermont, the state’s minimum wage will reach $13.67 — climbing $0.49 from the current $13.18 wage. The annual adjustment also affects the minimum wage for tipped workers, which will tick up from $6.59 to $6.84 per hour. Maine will see its hourly minimum wage tick up from $13.80 to $14.15 per hour. Maine requires annual adjustments to the minimum wage based on the cost-of-living. Portland is pushing its city minimum wage from $14 to $15. The state's new tipped wage in 2024 will be $7.08 per hour. The minimum wage in Connecticut will rise from the current rate of $15.00 per hour to $15.69 — the highest in New England. Beginning Jan. 1, and occurring annually each following Jan. 1, the wage will be adjusted according to the U.S. Department of Labor’s calculation of the employment cost index. Massachusetts' minimum wage will remain at $15 per hour in 2024, although there is a campaign to hike the wage again to $20. New Hampshire continues to have the lowest minimum wage in New England, matching the federal wage of $7.25. State lawmakers have defeated multiple attempts to increase it in recent years. The New England states are among 20 raising minimum wages for workers, further widening the gap between state requirements and the federal minimum wage, which has been static at $7.25 an hour since July 2009. In several states, the new minimum will more than double that rate. In Massachusetts, advocates are pushing a ballot question that would phase out the state’s “service rate” which lets restaurants pay workers $6.75 an hour if tips make up the difference between that and the state's $15 minimum wage. Under the question, the service rate would end by 2029. Organizers for the group One Fair Wage said they have collected enough signatures to clear an initial hurdle to gaining a slot on next year's ballot. "Massachusetts voters are ready to move away from outdated wage practices and towards a system that guarantees dignity, justice, and economic security for all workers," Saru Jayaraman, president of One Fair Wage, said in a written statement, The Massachusetts Restaurant Association opposes the question, saying the highest-paid employees in any restaurant are tipped employees, frequently averaging $20, $30, and sometimes even $50 per hour. A restaurant owner can employ more than two full time waitstaff employees for the same hourly rate as one minimum wage employee, said Jessica Muradian of Massachusetts Restaurant Association. “This is a win for the tipped employee because they are the highest compensated employee in the restaurant, it’s a win for the guest who is getting a full-service experience and a win for the restaurant operator who gets to employ as many people as possible,” she said in a statement. The U.S. Department of Labor in August has also announced a proposed rule that would let 3.6 million more workers qualify for overtime. The proposed regulation would require employers to pay overtime to salaried workers who are in executive, administrative and professional roles but make less than $1,059 a week, or $55,068 a year for full-time employees. That salary threshold is up from $35,568.

author: bristolpostnews@localworld.co.uk (Shannon Brown)
title: Live: Met Office forecasts UK snow amid travel disruption after destructive Storm Gerrit
text: Leftover strong winds from Storm Gerrit are still playing havoc with traffic in Bristol, with continued restrictions at the M48 Severn Bridge. [Traffic](https://www.bristolpost.co.uk/all-about/traffic-travel) between Bristol and Wales has been restricted for a few days following the onset of the storm, which has caused scaffolding and trees to fall, as well as cutting power across the UK. The Severn Bridge is currently open towards Bristol, according to traffic monitor Inrix, though the Wales-bound side has been closed. Inrix reports: "M48 Westbound closed due to strong winds at J1 A403 ( Aust ). This is in preparation for the increased winds speeds and an expected closure to high sided vehicles." One lane is still closed on the [M4 Prince of Wales bridge](https://www.bristolpost.co.uk/all-about/m4-motorway) after a serious crash on Wednesday (December 27). Both of these closures are likely to contribute to delays between Bristol and Wales throughout the day, particularly with a host of holidaymakers expected to set off ahead of the New Year's weekend. Inrix adds: "One lane closed due to emergency barrier repairs on M4 Prince of Wales Bridge in both directions between J22 M49 and J23 M48." The worst of the Storm Gerrit was experienced across the northwest of England on Thursday. Around 100 properties were damaged by what police called a “localised tornado” in Stalybridge, Tameside and in the badly-hit village of Carrbrook. Hayley McCaffer, 40, who lives in Carrbrook, told the PA news agency that some of her neighbours’ houses “are an absolute disaster” with missing roofs and “squished” cars. Damage will be covered by standard property insurance policies, the Association of British Insurers has said. Met Office chief forecaster Steven Ramsdale said: “Heavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday, affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.” This is a live blog. Scroll below for more. UK snow Steven Ramsdale is a Met Office Chief Forecaster. He said: “This system is likely to bring a range of weather including hill snow. Heavy rain will spread across all but the far north on Saturday affecting similar areas previously affected by Storm Gerrit. However, this rainfall will be a step down from that seen during Storm Gerrit.” One lane closed on M4 bridge after crash "One lane closed due to emergency barrier repairs on M4 Prince of Wales Bridge in both directions between J22 M49 and J23 M48." The lane has been closed since Wednesday, December 27 after a seven-car crash on the bridge sparked severe delays. [Read the full story here.](https://www.bristolpost.co.uk/news/bristol-news/m4-seven-vehicle-sparks-traffic-9000403) M48 closed westbound "M48 Westbound closed due to strong winds at J1 A403 ( Aust ). This is in preparation for the increased winds speeds and an expected closure to high sided vehicles."

author: Ryan Harkness
title: ‘Pumped’ White Ready To ‘DESTROY 2024’
text: Dana White is coming into 2024 feeling pumped up and ready to destroy. That’s the message he sent through his Instagram stories as he prepared to return to Las Vegas after a much needed family vacation in Bali. White’s New Year’s Eve coming into 2023 was nearly a career-killer after [video surfaced of him striking his wife](https://www.mmamania.com/videos/2023/1/2/23536428/video-embarrassed-dana-white-seen-slapping-wife-in-club-theres-never-ever-an-excuse-ufc) in a Cabo San Lucas, Mexico nightclub. The couple blamed the incident on too much alcohol and White somehow managed to [survive the media storm](https://www.mmamania.com/2023/1/8/23545540/jamie-foxx-d-l-hughley-call-out-dana-white-privilege-silence-over-domestic-abuse-slap-wife-continues) that follows this sort of bad behavior. There was none of that this year. 2024 was all positive vibes as his kids spent the holidays surfing, and Dana apparently brainstormed some powerful new ideas for the future. From Dana White's IG story— Jed I. Goodman © (@jedigoodman) [pic.twitter.com/RlYtOj46bQ] [January 6, 2024] White shared a Rick Rubin quote on his Instagram that read “Maybe the best idea is the one you’re going to come up with this evening.” “Truth!!! I have had a ton of them while on vacation,” White wrote in a Story. “I get home tomorrow and I am going to DESTROY January and 2024!” Hopefully some of those ideas have to do with UFC, but White is a man with many brands in the fire. He’s got Power Slap, which he’s pushing as the new [fastest growing sport in the world.](https://www.mmamania.com/2024/1/4/24025100/dana-white-claims-high-margin-high-cash-power-slap-already-profitable-unlike-pfl-rock-xfl-experiment) He’s got several bulls competing in the [Professional Bull Riders organization.](https://www.mmamania.com/2023/9/28/23894018/dana-whites-bull-twisted-steel-to-make-professional-bull-riders-debut-on-ufc-294-weekend) He’s somehow made a banana liquor ‘happen’ with Howler Head. And who knows what kind of crazy [Influencer partnerships](https://www.mmamania.com/2023/11/19/23968614/stevewilldoit-wins-5 -gambling-in-vegas-donates-it-to-dana-white) we’ll see this year? This new Dana White is unstoppable, and he [credits a lot of his energy to Gary Brecka,](https://www.mmamania.com/2023/9/29/23896039/ufc-dana-white-goes-nuts-insane-body-transformation-new-before-after-pics-mma) who saved him from an early grave. “69 hours into my fast, land in Vegas in 9hrs 25mins! Heading straight into the #Superhuman Protocol as soon as I land. PUMPED!!! Feeling amazing. Going into Monday like a f—in’ MANIAC. Haven’t felt this good since I was in my 20s/30s. Brecka’s [‘Superhuman Protocol’](https://www.mmamania.com/2022/9/24/23369756/dana-white-feels-35-again-after-being-marked-for-death-in-a-decade) involves fasting, light therapy, and oxygen therapy to “boost cellular function in the body from the inside out.” It’s certainly overhauled Dana’s health. White’s competitors better watch out because the UFC CEO is leaner and meaner than ever. author: Doug Newcomb
title: 2024 Genesis Electrified GV70 - Review 2024 - PCMag UK
text:
Pros Sharp exterior styling and first-class interior Advanced comfort features and driver assists Excellent performance and handling Cons Lower range than top competitors Limited cargo space Wonky remote parking system 2024 Genesis Electrified GV70 Specs Body Type Sedan Drivetrain All-Wheel-Drive Engine Dual electric motors; 429hp (320kW) Fuel Type Electric Range 236 miles Seating Capacity 5 Transmission Single-speed All Specs
Table of Contents Powerful Motors, Middling Range Loads of Standard Features Muscular Exterior, Luxury Interior Seamless Entertainment, Excellent Safety Features A 10-Second Rush of Acceleration Equal Parts Finesse and Features The Genesis Electrified GV70 (starting at $66,450) switches out the combustion engine of the Genesis G70 for a pair of electric motors, maintaining that model’s sleek exterior styling, spacious cabin, and convenient tech. It also handles confidently and packs serious horsepower. That said, the pricier Tesla Model X (starting at $79,990) remains our Editors' Choice winner thanks to its even more powerful engine, longer battery range, and larger cargo volume.
Powerful Motors, Middling Range The 2024 Genesis Electrified GV70 comes in two trims: Advanced ($66,450) and Prestige ($73,250). It's worth noting that this vehicle does not qualify for the federal EV tax credit in the US, unlike the Tesla Model X. Therefore, the actual purchase price for most Model X buyers ($72,490) is much closer to the GV70 than it seems.
Both Electrified GV70 models use a 77.4kWh battery that powers 160-kilowatt (kW) electric motors at the front and rear axles for all-wheel drive (AWD). The motors combine for 429 horsepower (hp) and 516lb-ft of torque. For reference, I tested the 2023 version of the vehicle, but Genesis hasn't made any notable changes for the 2024 model year, apart from adding Wi-Fi.
(Credit: Genesis) Both versions of the Electrified GV70 have an EPA-estimated driving range of 236 miles and get a combined MPGe of 91. For comparison, the EPA estimates that the base AWD Tesla Model X gets up to 348 miles of range and has an MPGe of 102 ( Tesla recently lowered its mileage claim to 335 miles). Meanwhile, the 2024 BMW iX xDrive50 ($87,100) has a range of 307 miles and an MPGe of 83.
(Credit: Doug Newcomb) The Electrified GV70 uses a Combined Charging System (CCS) port. Genesis says its 800-volt (V) architecture means it can charge from 10% to 80% in as little as 18 minutes at a DC fast charger with an output greater than 350kW (or 800V). That time goes up to around 73 minutes for chargers operating at 50kW. With a Level 2, 240V charger, the battery goes from 10% to 100% in about 7 hours. Finally, it should take roughly 68 hours to fully charge the vehicle with the included 120V cord.
I wasn't able to test fast charging above about 90kW, but at that rate it took 36 minutes to get from 7% to 80% and a full hour to get to 100%. A Level 2, 6.1kW charger took more than 13 hours to get the vehicle from 4% to 100%.
Like several other EV brands , Genesis says it's switching its vehicles to Tesla's North American Charging Standard (NACS) port starting at the end of 2024. Existing vehicle owners will be able to use Tesla Superchargers via an adapter starting in 2025. That might seem like a long way off, but Electrified GV70 buyers get three years of complimentary charging sessions at Electrify America stations from their date of purchase.
Loads of Standard Features The Advanced trim comes with 20-inch alloy wheels, an electronically controlled suspension with a Road Preview feature, folding exterior mirrors with puddle lamps, and a powered, hands-free liftgate. The interior has leather upholstery, a panoramic sunroof, and power heated and ventilated front seats. The driver's seat benefits from a powered cushion extension, side bolsters, an Ergo Motion feature (which uses seat movements to reduce fatigue), and a Smart Posture feature (which allows the driver to enter their height and weight for optimal support).
(Credit: Doug Newcomb) Standard tech includes an 8-inch digital instrument panel, a 14.5-inch infotainment touch screen, an AM/FM HD and satellite radio, Android Auto and Apple CarPlay , a fingerprint reader to start the engine and adjust personal settings, Genesis Connected Services, navigation, vehicle-to-load charging for small electronics, a Wi-Fi hotspot, and wireless device charging. As for safety tech, you get blind-spot view and assist, forward-collision warning with automatic emergency braking, lane centering, rear cross-traffic collision assist, and remote smart parking.
(Credit: Doug Newcomb) The Prestige trim I tested had a 12.3-inch 3D digital instrument cluster, a 15-speaker/1,050-watt Lexicon audio system, active noise control, a faux-leather-wrapped upper instrument panel, a heads-up display, heated rear seats, a heated steering wheel, Nappa leather seating surfaces, rear-door window shades, and a suede headliner. A $575 Savile Silver exterior paint option and a $1,125 delivery charge brought the final sticker price of my loaner to $74,950.
Muscular Exterior, Luxury Interior The Electrified GV70’s thin twin LED headlamps and silver diamond-patterned grille give the vehicle a bold and distinctive character. I particularly like how the latter cleverly hides the charging port. The wraparound taillights mirror the slim dual-LED light pattern, while a unique C pillar and parabolic lines down the side give the SUV a lean, aggressive appearance.
(Credit: Doug Newcomb) I think the white Nappa leather in the Electrified GV70 Prestige trim looks first-class and I like the clean design of the center console. That said, I often mistook the infotainment controller for the gear shift and vice versa since they are the same size. I'm generally not a fan of touch-controlled climate settings, but the ones in the center dash of the Electrified GV70 look elegant and are easy to operate thanks to their large rotary dials.
Like the Electrified GV80, one downside to the vehicle is a tiny frunk that's only big enough to store the supplied 110V charging cable. The rear cargo space with the second row folded down (56.5 cubic feet) falls far behind the Tesla Model X (85 cubic feet).
Seamless Entertainment, Excellent Safety Features The Electrified GV70’s interface system is identical to that of the Electrified G80, which is to say that the infotainment and instrument panels are separate. Its corporate cousins, such as the Hyundai Ioniq 5 , the Ioniq 6 , and the Kia EV6 , opt for a single dashboard screen. I prefer the latter, but the onboard system is intuitive and fairly customizable. You use the dashboard to see the remaining battery range on a map, locate charging stations, schedule charging, and more. Android Auto and Apple CarPlay provide maps, music, and messaging via a USB connection only, not wirelessly.
(Credit: Doug Newcomb) The vehicle has all the driver assists I expect, as well as some unique ones. For instance, the blind-view monitor shows an image of an obscured zone on either side of the vehicle when you activate the respective blinker, helpful for avoiding collisions with oncoming traffic. And the lane-centering feature, which Genesis calls Highway Driving Assist, is one the best I've tested. That said, the remote parking feature proved unreliable in testing. It presumably should let you guide the vehicle into a parking spot while you stand outside it, but I gave up on it after several failed attempts.

organizations.name: middling range loads of standard features muscular exterior

author: Alex Turk
title: Arsenal transfer priority becomes clear as West Ham loss ends horror David Moyes streak | Football | Sport | Express.co.uk
text:
In pictures: Arsenal v West Ham
Arsenal slumped to a woeful 2-0 defeat against West Ham United at the Emirates Stadium on Thursday night, surrendering the Premier League top spot to Liverpool . Express Sport looks at four key talking points as David Moyes and the Hammers enjoyed another fine day's work at Mikel Arteta's expense.
Related articles
Arsenal ace Kai Havertz replaced by 16-year-old as Mikel Arteta gets adventurous
Arsenal in new VAR farce as Gunners convinced West Ham goal shouldn't have stood Arsenal need striker for the title Arsenal had chances aplenty throughout the night but couldn't find the clinical edge that their main title rivals, Liverpool and Manchester City, have boasted for years.
Mohamed Salah and Erling Haaland have each netted more Premier League goals than Arteta's two strikers - Gabriel Jesus and Eddie Nketiah - combined this season.
January isn't renowned for being the optimum time for high-profile transfer business. However, Arsenal need to buck that trend this winter and make a signing that they won't win the title without.
READ MORE Transfer news as Man Utd receive Greenwood bid and Chelsea strike January deal [BLOG]
Konstantinos Mavropanos haunted Arsenal on Thursday. (Image: Getty) Moyes breaks nightmare streak Before this evening, Moyes had never won a Premier League game as a manager away at Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool or Manchester United in 72 attempts.
He had only gone without a league victory against Chelsea (23 games) longer than Arsenal, drawing four and losing 18 of his previous meetings.
But Moyes ended that nightmare run by ending the Gunners' 13-game unbeaten streak at home in all competitions, stretching back to a 3-0 loss to Brighton and Hove Albion in May.
Arsenal had won their previous seven games at the Emirates by an aggregate score of 21-2. It's an excellent result for West Ham just days after their 2-0 triumph over United.
Become an Express Premium member
Support fearless journalism
Read The Daily Express online, advert free
Get super-fast page loading Start 30-day
FREE trial More VAR controversy for Arteta Arteta was left furious after a controversial goal that saw Newcastle United beat Arsenal 1-0 earlier in the season.
There was mass debate over whether Joe Willock had kept the ball in play during the move, which ended with Anthony Gordon scoring the winner.
This time, VAR couldn't provide a definitive call on whether Jarrod Bowen had kept the ball in before assisting Tomas Soucek's opener. Therefore, Michael Oliver's on-field decision stood.
Konstantinos Mavropanos - who joined West Ham in a £19million deal in the summer - came back to haunt his former club Arsenal by heading in the second after half-time.
DON'T MISS
Arsenal duo blocking Liverpool transfer as Man City fear deal haunting Guardiola [TRANSFERS]
Arteta 'blocks three January exits' as Arsenal boss risks souring relationships [NEWS]
Man Utd outcast Jadon Sancho spotted in rare footage as PSG 'make transfer call' [FILMED]
Arsenal need a new striker in January. (Image: Getty) READ MORE
Luke Littler sends forgotten Man Utd star a message at World Darts Championship Another unhappy reunion for Rice Declan Rice didn't enjoy his return to the London Stadium earlier in the season as West Ham dumped Arsenal out of the Carabao Cup with a 3-1 win.
And the former Hammers captain endured another woeful night in the Premier League , conceding a stoppage-time penalty to put the cherry on the cake.
Said Benrahma failed to compile the misery on Arsenal from the spot, but it did little to dampen the mood in the away end at full-time.
Rice will have been delighted with his £105m switch to north London earlier this year. But it's fair to say he wouldn't have expected to have already lost twice to his ex-employers this term.
